title: (x) Propel / wide convex square sans - various suggestions {gang}
content:
(This may be the wrong forum to post this in)

I am designing a new logo, and I am trying to find a font that closest resembles a drawing I made. The closest I can find is Stainless from Font Bureau. I don't want it to be too stiff like ITC Blair. I want it to have slight bends similar to the icon. Any help would be appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130304225319im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_1956_6339.JPG)
author: cannon46

comments.content: Fontpartners' [FP Head](http://web.archive.org/web/20130304225319/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/families/fp_head_pro/?&sample_text=PROPEL%20PLANNING&update=0) and [FF Max](http://web.archive.org/web/20130304225319/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/families/ff_max) aren't exactly like your sketch, but they might have a slight bend like the one you describe.

I immediately thought of [Mata](http://web.archive.org/web/20130304225319/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/mata/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D240%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DPrOPEL%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%26seed%3D16), but I think it was a bit overused about 10 years ago.

- Lex
